events.1620: Amarsingh I, Rajput's guhilot lineage king of Mewad, died.
events.1681: Sambhaji was crowned as the successor of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in a function held at Raigad Fort.
events.1818: The Rana of Udaipur signed a treaty with the British to protect Mewad.
events.1858: Baithi, Laikha, Ratna, Maani, and the women who participated in Mairath Kranti at Gudgaon, all were hanged.
events.1896: Jaideva Singh, famous musician and educationist, was born Shohratgarh, U.P.
events.1901: Mahadeo Govind Ranade, eminent social worker and thinker, passed away.
events.1916: Amat Debananda, politician, was born in Balani village at Orissa .
events.1919: Nasikrao Khantadu Tirpude, former Duputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra, was born.
events.1920: Nani Palkhiwala, famous law expert, was born.
events.1924: In a tragic ship wreck, Kumaran Asan, famous Malayalam poet & eminent social worker, died.
events.1938: Sarat Chandra Chatterji, famous Bengali novelist and  writer, passed away.
events.1941: Ashok Vajpai, veteran critic and Hindi poet, was born.
events.1942: Jawaharlal Nehru succeeds Gandhi as head of Indian National Congress.
events.1945: Kabir Bedi, famous Hindi and foreign actor (Thief of Baghdad, Terminal Entry), was born.
events.1948: Pakistan charges India with systematic campaign to wipe out Muslims.
events.1954: Baburao Painter (Baburao Krishnaji Meshri), famous artist, sculptor, filmmaker and producer, died.
events.1966: Sadhu Thanwardas Lilaram Vaswani, noted thinker and saint poet, great orator, professor and prolific writer, died at Pune.
events.1973: Om Prakash Mehra, Air Chief Marshal PVSM, became the Air Officer Commanding, India Command. He was in this office till 31/01/1976.
events.1985: Balram Jakhar elected Speaker of the Lok Sabha.
events.1988: L. K. Jha, famous economist and member of Rajya Sabha, died.
events.1989: Prem Nazir, famous actor of more than 620 Malayalam films, died at the age of 59 yrs.
events.1990: Dr. R.R. Diwakar, Gandhian and former Union Minister, passed away.
events.1992: For the first time in a decade, India decides to import one million tonnes of wheat.
events.1995: Missile carrier vessel 'Vidhrut' dedicated to nation.
events.1996: Union Cabinet Minister V.C. Shukla, Balram Jhakar, Madhavrao Scindia, and others including BJP President L.K. Advani, Arjun Singh and Devi Lal chargesheeted in the multi-crore Jain `Hawala' case. CBI seeks sanction to prosecute them. L.K. Advani resigns from Lok Sabha membership.
events.1997: Dr. Datta Samant, Trade Union leader, shot dead in Mumbai.
events.1999: Ritwick Bhattacharya (Delhi) and Mekhala Subedar (Maharashtra) won the men's and women's titles in the National squash championship in Calcutta.
events.2000: Punjab men, Railway women win the Senior National Volleyball championship in Salem.
